metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11715 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Due to an error while parsing page content, it is possible for properly sanitized user input to be misinterpreted and lead to XSS hazards on web sites in certain circumstances. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
